headline: Why Super Micro Computer Stock Surged Today
summary: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) stock posted big gains in Friday's trading.  The server specialist's share price closed out the day's trading up 10.9% amid gains of 1.2% for the S&P 500 index and 1.7% for the Nasdaq Composite index.  In addition to bullish momentum for the broader market today, Super Micro Computer (also called Supermicro) stock got a big boost from new artificial intelligence (AI) spending guidance from one of the tech industry's biggest players.

In addition to bullish momentum for the broader market today, Super Micro Computer (also called Supermicro) stock got a big boost from new artificial intelligence (AI) spending guidance from one of the tech industry's biggest players.

headline: Microsoft to spend $80B on data centers in 2025
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) plans to invest $80 billion in artificial intelligence data centers throughout 2025, with nearly half earmarked for US infrastructure development. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley analyzes Microsoft's expansion plans and efforts to capitalize on what the company calls "the electricity of the modern age." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Microsoft to spend $80 billion in FY'25 on data centers for AI
summary: Microsoft has earmarked $80 billion in fiscal 2025 to build data centers designed to handle artificial intelligence workloads, according to a company blog post. Specifically, the tech giant plans to build out AI-enabled data centers “to train AI models and deploy AI and cloud-based applications around the world.” Of that $80 billion allocation, more than half will be spent in the United States, according to Microsoft Vice Chair and President Brad Smith. headline: The 1 Tech Stock That’s Actually a Bargain
summary: A new entrant in the Big Tech club of stocks means it’s time for a new name to describe tech’s largest companies.  What was once FANG, and then FAANG, FAMANG, and most recently Magnificent Seven, is now best labeled as BATMMAAN.  The new group consists of  Broadcom Apple Tesla Microsoft Meta Platforms Alphabet Amazon  and  Nvidia  All of them carry market values above $1 trillion.

headline: Microsoft vs. Amazon: Which Cloud-Computing Stock Will Outperform in 2025?
summary: Both Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) saw strong growth in their cloud-computing business units in 2024.  While Microsoft's Azure saw the higher revenue growth, it was Amazon's stock that outperformed in 2024.  Cloud computing has been one of the biggest areas of growth stemming from the rise in artificial intelligence (AI), as organizations use services from these companies to help build their own AI models and applications.

headline: These 5 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks Make Up 28.8% of the Entire S&P 500 Index
summary: The S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) is home to 500 companies from 11 different sectors of the economy, making it the most diversified of the major U.S. stock market indexes.  The S&P 500 delivered a return of 25% during 2024, whereas the S&P 500 Equal Weight index, which assigns the same weighting to every stock regardless of its market cap, was up by just 10%.

headline: Tech Stocks Look Overvalued, With 1 Surprising Exception
summary: A new entrant in the Big Tech club of stocks means it’s time for a new name to describe tech’s largest companies.  The new group consists of  Broadcom Apple Tesla Microsoft Meta Platforms Alphabet Amazon  and  Nvidia  All of them carry market values above $1 trillion.  The eight stocks were up by an average of 66% in 2024 versus the S&P 500 index performance of 23%.
